translation: With the shouts of “kill, kill”, the warriors were uttering dreadful words.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰੇ ਅੰਗ ਭੰਗੰ || ਦਵੰ ਜਾਨ ਦੰਗੰ ||੨੧||
transliteration: Gire An Bhanadg|| Davan Jaan Danndan||21||
translation: The chopped limbs of the warriors are falling and it appeared that there is fire on all the four sides.21.

gurmukhi: ਗੲੇ ਛੂਟ ਅਸਤ੍ਰੰ || ਭਜੇ ਹ੍ਵੈ ਨ੍ਰਿਅਸਤ੍ਰੰ ||
transliteration: Gad Chhodht Astran|| Bhaje Hvai Nri-astran||
translation: The weapons began to fall from the hands and the warriors began to run away empty-handed.

transliteration: Khilen Saar Baajee|| Ture Tound Taajee||22||
translation: The horses were neighing and were running hither and thither with swiftness.22.

gurmukhi: ਭੁਜਾ ਠੋਕ ਬੀਰੰ || ਕਰੇ ਘਾੲਿ ਤੀਰੰ ||
transliteration: Bhujaa Thok Bderan|| Dare Ghaae Tderan||
translation: The warriors are wounding the enemy by showering their arrows; they were also patting their arms.

gurmukhi: ਨੇਜੇ ਗੱਡ ਗਾਢੇ || ਮਚੇ ਬੈਰ ਬਾਢੇ ||੨੩||
transliteration: Neja Gadd Gaddhe|| Mache Bair Baadhe||23||
translation: The warriors by planting their daggers, increasing their inimical intentions, are waging a terrible war. 23

gurmukhi: ਘਣੰ ਘਾੲਿ ਪੇਲੇਂ || ਮਨੋ ਫਾਗ ਖੇਲੇਂ ||
transliteration: Ghanan Ghaae Pelen|| Mano Phaag Khelen||
translation: Many wounds are being inflicted and the wounded warriors appear to be playing Holi;

gurmukhi: ਕਰੇਂ ਬਾਣ ਬਰਖਾ || ਭੲੇ ਜੀਤ ਕਰਖਾ ||੨੪||
transliteration: Daren Baan Barkhaa|| Bhae Jeet Karkhaa||4||
translation: Showering their arrows, all are desirous of the victory.24.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰੇ ਅੰਤ ਘੂਮੰ || ਮਨੋ ਬ੍ਰਿੱਛ ਝੂਮੰ || ਟੁਟੇ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਸਤ੍ਰੰ || ਭਜੇ ਹੁਅੈ ਨ੍ਰਿਅਸਤ੍ਰੰ ||੨੫||
transliteration: Gire Ant Ghooman|| Mano Brichchh Jhooman|| Toute Sastra Astran|| Bhaje Huai Nri-astraaan||25||
translation: The warriors are roaming and falling like the swinging, after the breaking of their weapons and becoming trees armless, the warriors sped away.25.
